title: I legitimately don't understand.
body:
We had a Shen top vs an Ekko and a Brand mid vs an Ahri.

Shen and Gragas killed Ekko, Shortly afterwards Brand killed Ahri, then while Brand was on low HP Ekko teleported from base into the mid lane, Brand sees the teleport swirly shit and moves away, just at that time however enemy Xin (jungle) moves in from the side and pushes Brand away from the turret and into the bush where he is chased down by Ekko and killed, Shen's ult was on CD.

{{champion:63}} : Yaknow...
{{champion:63}} : Mias would be nice!
{{champion:98}} : He teleported in from base?
{{champion:98}} : You saw the teleport..
{{champion:98}} : What do you want? 
{{champion:63}} : I want mia when he leaves lane.
{{champion:98}} : he died, there was a big ass message on screen?

Now we won the game, everyone played well, and i shouldnt be complaining. but i fail to understand how anyone can believe that Brand's death could be Shen's fault. Nothing Shen could have done could have saved Brand, short of falling on his knees and praying to whatever deity might listen for Ekko's computer to glitch, and there was nothing Brand could have done to avoid the situation, neither player was at fault, Shen couldn't mia because Ekko died and had just re-spawned, and teleport gives a pretty fair warning that someone is on the way. And brand wasn't out of position because he had just won a fight with Ahri (so he cant be expected to engage in a fight, win by the skin of his teeth AND end the fight with perfect positioning against a 2 man gank with champions with dashes at the end of it.) and had no way of knowing that Xin and Ekko would both converge on him.

So literally no-one made a mistake, so why is there the need for Brand to blame anyone when its so obviously no-ones fault?

I just don't understand some people's thinking.
